column4: Hi.. I installed ubuntu 10.04 with grub2 (previously had debian lenny with grub1).. Now I booted to a grub 15 error.. Anyone know how to fix it?
do you have a live CD?
If so could you post (not in the IRC channel) from boot/grub/grub.conf
DO I need that?.. I have a ubuntu 10.04 server cd.
most installation CD's will act like a live cd
unless you customized it in some way, so just boot from that
okok.. How do I correct it after I boot from it?
well, AFAIK, error 15 is a file not found error. It may be something in grub.conf or another grub configuration file
I think I saw this error as a common thing with ubuntu 10.04.. in a FAQ.
I'd look over it myself and post it to pastebin and post it here so anyone can take a gander at it and spot something out of place in the configuration file
There's some solutions there it seems
the solution says to reinstall from a live CD :) https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Grub2#Reinstalling%20from%20LiveCD
